unit.label: Act IV, Scene III
unit.title: SCENE III. Alexandria. Before the Palace.

conventions.dash_policy: classify em/en/hyphen as separate tokens; all dash types normalize to "-"
conventions.bracket_policy: strip underscores and outer brackets from stage spans

spans.text: SCENE III. Alexandria. Before the Palace.
Brother, good night. Tomorrow is the day.
It will determine one way. Fare you well.
Heard you of nothing strange about the streets?
Belike ’tis but a rumour. Good night to you.
And you. Good night, good night.
They place themselves in every corner of the stage.
Our navy thrive, I have an absolute hope
’Tis a brave army, and full of purpose.
Music of the hautboys under the stage.
It signs well, does it not?
Peace, I say! What should this mean?
’Tis the god Hercules, whom Antony loved,
Walk. Let’s see if other watchmen
How now! How now! Do you hear this?
Do you hear, masters? Do you hear?
Follow the noise so far as we have quarter.
Let’s see how it will give off.
